title: Calories in a Brat
meta_description: Learn calories in a brat, with full nutrition facts including protein, fat, carbs, sodium, and easy tweaks for different preparations.
assumptions: Standard pork bratwurst (â‰ˆ85 g), cooked by grilling, no bun, toppings, or added oil.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, meat type (pork, beef, chicken), size, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One grilled bratwurst provides about 290 kcal and 14 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add a standard hot dog bun

faqs.q: How many calories in a brat?
faqs.a: Approximately 290 kcal for one standard grilled pork bratwurst.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a brat?
faqs.a: About 14 g of protein per bratwurst.
Yes, typically 25 g total fat, including 9 g saturated fat per brat.

faqs.q: Calories in a turkey brat vs. pork?
faqs.a: Turkey brats are lower, around 140-160 kcal each, with less fat.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in a brat?
faqs.a: Grilling or boiling keeps calories similar; frying adds 50-100 kcal from oil.
